alert.note: Alert for Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:57PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Elmore and east central Owyhee Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 456 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bruneau Sand Dunes, or 17 miles west of Glenns Ferry, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenns Ferry, Bruneau Sand Dunes, Deadman Flat, Hammett, King Hill and Twentymile Butte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
